content.p: The purpose of this chapter is to protect the interests of the United States and of the participants and their beneficiaries in Government pension plans by requiring complete disclosure of the financial condition of those plans.

subparagraph.content: means a pension, annuity, retirement, or similar plan (except a plan covered under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (29 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.) or a plan or program financed by contributions required under chapter 21 or 22 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (26 U.S.C. 3101 et seq., 3201 et seq.)) established or maintained by an agency, for any of its officers or employees, regardless of the number of participants covered by the plan; and

clause.content: the Commissioned Corps of the Public Health Service Retirement System.
the Farm Credit District Retirement Plans.
the Federal Home Loan Bank Board Retirement Systems.
the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Plan.
the Federal Reserve Employees Retirement Plans.
the Foreign Service Retirement and Disability System.
the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Retirement System.
the Tennessee Valley Authority Retirement System.

paragraph.content: “plan year” means the calendar, policy, or fiscal year chosen by the Government pension plan on which the records of the plan are kept.

subsection.content: Repealed. Pub. L. 105–362, title XV, § 1501(a), Nov. 10, 1998, 112 Stat. 3294.]
This chapter does not prevent a Government pension plan from using the services of an enrolled actuary employed by an agency administering the plan.

The requirements of this section are satisfied with respect to the Thrift Savings Plan described under subchapter III of chapter 84 of title 5, by preparation and transmission of the report described under section 8439(b) of such title.

section.heading: Review and recommendations
section.chapeau: When necessary or when requested by either House of Congress or a committee of Congress, the Comptroller General shall—

paragraph.content: review financial and actuarial statements provided under section 9503 of this title to decide whether the reporting requirements of section 9503 are adequate to carry out section 9501 of this title; and
submit to Congress recommendations for legislation necessary to carry out section 9501 of this title.
